text:
Students are informed that the University has issued first voucher (Semester Enrollment fee + One Course fee) for Fall, 2020 semester to continuing students, who have made course selection from October 22, 2020 to October 29, 2020. 

You are directed to deposit payable voucher as per given schedule.

text.text: To find email addresses of other VU students

text: , log in to your VU Gmail account and then visit this link:

It will take some time to load. Eventually, it will display all the email addresses that are present in the VU organization.

The administrators have kept some addresses hidden probably for privacy and to fight spam.

You can look up other students from your batch, using your VU ID.

text.text: Kindly do not use abuse this system.

text: So far, VU has not provided any way for students to communicate with each other.

text.text: If you misuse it, then administrators can hide the directory, and we will not be able to discover our fellow batch members.

text.text: CS702 - Advanced Algorithms Analysis and Design
CS702 - Advanced Algorithms Analysis and Design
JFLAP 7.0 Simulator Tutorial for designing Turing Machines

text:
Please visit following tutorial link for using the JFLAP 7.0 Simulator. 

JFLAP is software for experimenting with formal languages topics including nondeterministic finite automata, Turing machines, and multi-tape Turing machines. 

In addition to constructing and testing examples for these, JFLAP allows one to experiment with construction proofs from one form to another. 

This tutorial will help design the Turing machine in upcoming your assignment task.

text.text: On issues and bugs in the new version of LMS

text: Recently, Virtual University of Pakistan launched a new version of LMS with a new user interface and intuitive features. However, some functionality and features have been presented differently for ease of use and student activity tracking. Like any new version of a software some features are liked by users and others take time getting used to.

text.text: The ICT teams are actively looking into any complaints and evaluating feedback in order to make it even better and more functional.
some miscreants started generating severe BruteForce and DDoS cyber-attacks on LMS to make it inaccessible

text:
for obvious reasons. The ICT teams are continuously taking measures to mitigate these attacks on our websites and will not rest till the issue is resolved. We regret the inconvenience caused and appreciate your patience.

The University authorities have identified these sources and gathered the requisite information, which is now being sent to FIA Cyber Crimes wing for further action against these culprits.

Furthermore, to compensate students with their graded activities the university extended the deadlines for different graded activities as deemed appropriate, so that students could make their submissions.

2. (b) Home based/overseas students may send directly to VU Head Office address.
3. VU ID must be clearly mentioned on top right corner of the migration certificate.

text.text: List of Merit Based Scholarship Fall, 2020

text:
The Management Committee for Scholarships has finalized the students for Merit Scholarship (Newly Admitted Students) for Fall 2020. 

Only those students are enlisted for scholarship who have obtained highest percentage marks in his/her previous degree. The students who have scored highest percentage marks and his/her name is mentioned in the above list and obtained percentage marks ranged as given in column (B) will be eligible for merit scholarship as mentioned in column (C).

Errors and Omissions Excepted, within two weeks after publication of merit scholarship list. (Queries to be sent; if any at

)
The Students those having percentage marks‚Äô range but not mentioned in list are not eligible for scholarship because only top students those having highest marks are considered for scholarship.

text.text: HEC advises universities to conduct exams based on their capacity and need for fair assessment

text: Higher Education Commission (HEC) has taken note of the

text.text: concerns raised by students of some universities that their examinations should be conducted online

text:
. The apprehensions of students were reviewed carefully in consultation with the Vice Chancellors of all the provinces and regions, keeping in view the difficulties brought about by the pandemic and opening of universities from February 01, 2021.

HEC Guidance on Assessment and Examinations is available at the link

. 

In this policy, HEC already allowed universities to use their

to conduct exams, either on-campus or online as long as the chosen mode provides a fair assessment of students' performance. Universities should take stock of their "exam readiness", i.e., technological readiness, managerial capacity, and the announced policy, and choose the best possible mode of assessment. 

Online exams either can be used if the universities administer 'Open Book Exams' or establish an invigilation system in a supervised environment. In this mode, universities will also have to use Turnitin to check similarity index with Web and the answers of other students. Further, viva/oral exam may be integrated in the assessment where necessary.

On-campus exams can be used only under strict compliance with all Covid-19 health and safety protocols. Universities may also have to organize make-up classes for two weeks in case students consider the course coverage to be deficient. Assessment of all courses requiring psychomotor skills, such as medicine, engineering, subjects involving lab/studio work must be held on campus.

All students in a single course will be examined in the same mode i.e., either on-line or on-campus.

text.text: Fall 2020 Final Term Examinations: Make Your Date Sheet Now!
Guidelines for Overseas Students For Fall 2020 Final Term Examination

text: As an overseas student You must adhere to "Code of Conduct Outside of Pakistan" from the following link:

Overseas Exam Software and related materials have been made available for download. Please make sure to install latest exam application available on the link given below. You must follow the sequence of instructions given below for smooth and error free installation:
1. Download and install VUTES exam software from following link

.
2. Download and install only TeamViewer on workstation from following link:

.
Note: Install the TeamViewer software for Personal/Non-Commercial use.
3. Uninstall antivirus applications and disable windows firewall before the start of paper.
4. System default language MUST be English (United States). It can be set from Control Panel -> Region and Language -> Format
5. No proxy software/remote control software (except TeamViewer) should be installed or configured on the machine (like ultra-surf, hotspot shield, LogMeIn etc.).
6. Disable Internet Explorer Proxy settings. It can be disabled from Internet Options -> Connections -> LAN Settings and uncheck proxy server settings.
7. Do not configure external webcam to any other application (like MSN, Yahoo, Skype etc.); otherwise exam application will not detect the external webcam.
8. After installation, you must go through the ‚ÄúUser Manual‚Äù for Know-How to attempt your paper.
9. An icon will be visible on your desktop after installation of VUTES exam application. Please double click the icon to run the demo test.
You may test your installation by joining any of the following sessions till February 25, 2021 during the specified session timings as mentioned below:

text.text:
Session 1:      07:30 A.M to 09:00 A.M (PST)
Session 2:      09:30 A.M to 11:00 A.M (PST)
Session 3:      11:30 A.M to 01:00 P.M (PST)
Session 4:      02:30 P.M to 04:00 P.M (PST)
Session 5:      04:30 P.M to 06:00 P.M (PST)
Session 6:      06:30 P.M to 08:00 P.M (PST)

text: Please use your student ID as login and password for login into the exam application to check demo test. For example,

text.text:
Student ID: BC19020XXXX (Your student ID)
Password: BC19020XXXX (Your student ID)

text: After completing the demo test, you must confirm your installation status by clicking the link ‚ÄúClick here to confirm your installation status‚Äù given on
Note: There are no invigilators present during the demo sessions, so no need to reply the messages during demo. You can send us your feedback at

"during demo sessions for support.

UAN: +9242111880880 Ext: 352
Direct:

Due Date: 2021-02-13

You can select any topic from the list for Presentation.

1.   Do running time of Algorithm effects its efficiency?
2.   Fundamental Data Structures Used in Algorithms.
3.   Sorting Algorithms and their efficiency, considering time complexity.
4.   Searching Algorithms and their efficiency, considering time complexity.
5.   Graph Representation VS Tree Representation

See these messages for submission format and guidelines.

text.text: AI001 - Introduction to AI for IT and Non-IT Professionals

text:
Present an NP-Complete problem which is not already discussed in the video lectures.

See these messages for submission format and guidelines.

The University has unblocked LMS Accounts of the students in order to facilitate them in making date sheet for Fall'2020 (Final-Term) Exams and carry out other academic activities. However, It is advised to

text.text: clear outstanding dues at the earliest

text:
to avoid blocking after the examination. 

Students with blocked accounts will not be able to view Final-term result for Fall'2020 semester and make course selection for Spring'2021 semester.

messages.text:
Inside the mind of a master procrastinator
Tim Urban - Ted Talk

This video is posted on this channel to help students understand why they keep postponing their assignments and exam preparations till the last moment.

1. Viva will be conducted through Skype

Please note that this is last and final chance for appearance in the Entry Test failing which your admission will be cancelled and all submitted fee will be forfeited.

Please do not forget to take a printout of your Exam Entrance Slip which is sent on your VU email.

Enrollments Open For Introduction To Artificial Intelligence Short Course

text: The Virtual University of Pakistan has launched
of Introduction to Artificial Intelligence for IT And Non-IT Professionals certification course.

Completing this course will earn you
1. A Course Participation Certificate 
2. A VU Course Completion Certificate *
3. AI concept building with Real-life examples
* Terms & Conditions Apply

Batch Duration: 6 Weeks
Videos Duration: 14 hours
Fee: Free of Cost
Who can Join: Intermediate
For more information, please email at
